content: Only single digit quantities of dice can be rolled in one roll, modifier only allows 1-9. If the app is improved to allow much higher quantities of dice to be rolled (maybe 100+?) As well as higher modifiers like 100+ then I would consider reinstalling.

Would be perfect if you could set customized results. For example if I roll 7d10, could I have the results as, each die lowest to highest roll, then how many dice are over 7, and then a sum of all the dice?

I agree with the other reviewers that the login prompts are unnecessary and a bother (enough for me to find an alternative app) and the whole account feature is superfluous. The idea of a dice roller is quick easy access, otherwise I can just use some of the hundreds of die I've collect over a 40 year gaming career.

It's fine, I guess. But there are alternatives that work just as well, take up less space, and don't have any ridiculous login prompts to support unnecessary features... who actually needs to be able to access dice role history on all their devices? I suppose the ability to sync preferences could be nice in select cases, but nowhere near enough to bother with all that.
All left its to put some sound efects on it, aside that its an awesome app.

Useful for roleplaying... or deciding "where to eat" or " if I should go". If you aren't really sure about something, roll the dice and let the wheel of fate decide your path. (Blame the dice and the developers if something goes wrong)
It wants access to your Google account.  It's a dice roller and I see no need for anything like that to have such access.
replyContent:
Hello Rich,
Thanks for trying our app. The app wants you to sign into your Google account so it can save your roll favorites and history using Google's Firebase service. This would allow you to access your favorites and history across devices. 
The app WILL NOT use your Google account for anything other than that.
Thanks

content: This app is revolutionary to rig your hand when uou roll dice, I've won 200$
Doesn't work. I can't select dice, roll button does nothing.
replyContent:
Thank you for downloading and trying our app.  I'm sorry you ran into an issue.  Is there any chance you could provide some more information as to what happened? Perhaps you could give the app another try? 

You should be able to increment the number of each type of dice you'd like to roll, press roll, and immediately see the result of the roll.

content: I have always loved rolling my own dice but this app simply brings ease with every roll! There is no confusion it allows you to keep a history of which rolls you use the most. Not to mention the apps interface is undeniably smooth and works flawlessly. Good job! Cant wait to see what else is in store for the future.
the interface is pretty clean, but strictly limited to D20 systems. No open rolls, discard lowest or specific dice for other systems.

Perfect for tabletop games, I use it for DnD and love having the favorites for common rolls. Keeps the game flowing nicely. Very versatile and easy to use as well. It has more than a lot of the simple apps out there and is very easy to use straight away.

Absolute essential for D&D. History of rolls is very useful. Ability to roll multiple dice at the same time with breakdown of results is really great. This really helps to move the game along. GUI is very clean and user friendly. Thumbs UP!

Ok, this app is awesome! It saves your previous rolls so there's no guessing what your roll was when you missed it or need to look back later. Then you can save your favorite rolls. The favorites and history stick around even after you close the app! Amazing!
Simply the best dice roller app. Clean interface, easy to use, and you can roll multiple dice at once.
If you're a DM, and you want to keep the pace up, use this.  So much faster than real dice, and with favorites, you can always be ready for combat!
This app is awesome. You get a history and favorites. It makes it so much easier to reroll without setting up all the die each time you open the app.
